title: Pep Guardiola is to blame for Manchester City's defensive struggles, insists Alan Shearer
text:
Sport Pep Guardiola is to blame for Manchester City's defensive struggles, insists Alan Shearer City blew a two-goal lead to draw 2-2 with Spurs and ended the weekend 12 points off top spot in the Premier League Share Pep Guardiola's City have a poor defensive record (Photo: Clive Mason) Share Get football   
Alan Shearer reckons Pep Guardiola is to blame for Manchester City's defensive struggles. 
City blew a two-goal lead to draw 2-2 with Tottenham on Saturday and ended the weekend 12 points adrift of Premier League leaders Chelsea. 
Guardiola's men were denied a clear penalty for a foul on Raheem Sterling when leading 2-1 before Son Heung-min netted Spurs' equaliser just moments later, but Shearer says that isn't an excuse for City's defensive shortfalls. 
"City simply cannot defend and a lot of the indecision at the back comes from the indecision of the manager," Shearer said in The Sun. 
"He changes from three at the back to four or five. The personnel change regularly too and the ones that do play look uncertain about their role.
